items.sentence: Tom said that he thought that he should study French.
Tom said that he thought that he had to study French.
Tom said that he thought that he had to speak French.
Tom said he wished that he could speak French better.
Tom said that he didn't want to study French anymore.
Tom not only visited Boston, he also visited Chicago.
Tom not only visited Boston, he visited Chicago, too.
Tom's paper was published in a peer-reviewed journal.
How did you know Tom wasn't going to be in Australia?
How do you know that Tom has never been to Australia?
Does anybody know how Tom will be going to Australia?
I'm surprised you didn't know Tom could speak French.
Tom told Mary you'd finished the work three days ago.
The possibility Tom might be doing that worried Mary.
I don't think that Tom knows Mary is in the hospital.
I don't think that Tom knows Mary is already married.
I don't think that Tom knows why Mary went to Boston.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary would be angry.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary would be alone.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was optimistic.
